meanings.definition: To pray more effectively or fervently than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She was outpraying her friend during the prayer circle.
meanings.sent2: The devoted monk was outpraying all the other worshippers in the temple.
meanings.sent3: The little girl thought she was outpraying the birds with her bedtime prayers.
meanings.sent4: His heartfelt prayers were outpraying the storm raging outside.
meanings.sent5: The old man's outpraying filled the church with a sense of peace and hope.

meanings.definition: The act of praying more fervently or effectively than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Her outpraying of the others was evident in the intensity of her prayers.
meanings.sent2: The competition turned into an outpraying match between the two friends.
meanings.sent3: The outpraying contest at the church fundraiser was both amusing and heartwarming.
meanings.sent4: His outpraying of the storm seemed to calm the turbulent weather.
meanings.sent5: The outpraying of the entire congregation created a powerful spiritual energy in the room.
